main event: Two brilliant white light sources generally triangular in shape were observed moving with variable speed over the Panama Canal Zone on March 9-10, 1958.
interesting points: The objects were observed at a high altitude and appeared to have a definite movement without any hostility,The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes and was about 30 miles away,They were seen in silhouette against a bright sky,The shapes of the objects appeared triangular,The sighting seemed to be influenced by weather conditions, particularly strong cumulus clouds.
witness description: Captain Harold Salmine, operations and Training Officer, Caribbean Command
